bib_record.title: -The (N,2N) cross section of be-9 in the energy region 2.0 - 6.4 MeV-

free_txt: 5.5 MeV Van de Graaff accelerator
.The (N,2N) cross section was calculated using the
total cross section of be-9 from the compilation by
Doherty, aeew-m513(1965), in order to account for the
sample thickness.
.Multiple scattering was corrected by use of a MONTE-
CARLO program.
The correction was 14 perc. At 4.2 MeV and the error
was estimated to be less then 2 per-cent.
.Variation of neutron detector efficiency with neutron
energy.  The correction was 8 perc. At 6.4 MeV
.Absorption of the (N,2N) neutrons by the (N,alpha)
process in the be sample. The correction was 2 perc.
At 6.4 MeV with an estimated error of 1 per-cent.
.Neutron escape along the axial channel of the
scintillator tank.  The correction was (2+-1) perc.
.Spectrum of incident neutrons.  The correction was
(3+-1) perc. at 6.40 MeV
.Neutron flux correction (2+-1) per-cent.
.The (N,2N) cross section increases rapidly above the
threshold at 2.70 MeV for the inelastic neutron
scattering to the 2.43 MeV level of be-9, which sub-
sequently decays by neutron emission.
.There also exists a small (N,2N) cross section in the
energy range 2.0 - 2.7 MeV.
Gd-loaded liquid scintillator Ne313 in a
cylindrical tank, 50 cm in diameter, 50 cm in length
six 12.7 cm photomultipliers.
.Detector efficiency determined on 85+-2 per-cent by a
98-Cf-252 nu-bar measurement, (nu-bar = 3.772+-0.020).
.Time correlation measurements via a coincidence
circuit, on thermal capture pulses, (prompt recoil
pulses are removed).
.Carbon scatterer used to determine zero correlation.
Plastic scintillator located at the center
of the channel through the scintillator tank during
absolute neutron flux measurement runs.
A long counter at a distance of 5 m from the
target was used as a monitor of the relative neutron
flux.
.Efficiency of large liquid scintillator for (N,2N)
reaction  error  5 perc.
.Efficiency of plastic scintillator  error  3 perc.
.Number of counts recorded in plastic scintillator
error  3-4  perc.
.Number of (N,2N) events recorded by the large liquid
scintillator  error  2  perc.
.Corrections   error  3  perc.
.Total error in the energy region above 2.80 MeV 8 perc
.The value is however (not linearly) dependent on the
values of Cf-252 nu-bar and of the be total
cross-section used.
5.5 MeV Van de Graaff accelerator
T(P,N)3He reaction up to 4.6 MeV
thin adsorbed tritium target
D(d,N)3He reaction above 4.6 MeV
The two neutrons in the (N,2N) reaction
were detected by a large liquid scintillator by
measuring the correlation time between the pulses due
to the two neutrons.
.Iron collimator, 20 cm square, 1.5 m long
surrounded by lead and paraffin shields.
Be sample in the form of discs
3 cm in diameter and with a length corresponding
to about 1/3 of the total mean free path for neutrons.
Data from publication
Neutrons
